That is a very good explanation =C2=A0=C2=A0EM=C2=A0covers just about every=
 known form of=C2=A0energy I know=C2=A0of.

Nice work 

=C2=A0"Nature is sh=
owing us only the tail of the lion, but I have no doubt that the lion belon=
gs to it even though, because of its large size, it cannot totally reveal i=
tself all at once." 
-=E2=80=94 Albert Einstein 


"It is far better to gra=
sp the universe as it really is than to persist in delusions, however satis=
fying and reassuring."
--Carl Sagan


"There is no such thing as an insigni=
ficant detail. Don't just look 
for what you want to find."
-- Me LOL 




=
________________________________
From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@...>
To:=
 EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, June 8, 2009 3:43:47 PM
Subject: Re:=
 [EVP-ITC] New ideas





You can create a wave in anything. You can create=
 a wave in a rope by having a person hold each end and then having one pers=
on wiggle the rope. You can create a wave in a lake by dropping a rock into=
 it. The thing that carries the wave is the propagating medium. In these ex=
amples it's the rope and water respectively.

In the case of sound, the pro=
pagating medium is the air. It is a longitudinal pressure wave. It cannot b=
e picked up on a receiver that is capable of receiving the same frequencies=
 as electromagnetic waves.

There are receivers and antennas that can pick =
up electromagnetic waves of the same frequencies as sound waves. But in thi=
s case, the propagating medium is the aether. They are transverse electroma=
gnetic waves and you can't hear them.

The electromagnetic spectrum extends=
 from sub-audible frequencies all the way up to the frequencies of X-rays a=
nd cosmic rays. Different methods exist to detect or receive different part=
s of this spectrum. I'm involved in a ULF group that specializes in receivi=
ng electromagnetic waves of the Schumann resonances which are around 6 Hz, =
plus or minus.

Zack


=C2=A0
On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 2:38 PM, Frank Ratka <=
warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:




It sounds like she's saying "one, two, =
....."

A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking that there are two =
different types of energy at work when it comes to sound waves and electrom=
agnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is frequency and power. R=
adio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certain block of the elect=
romagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spectrum just farther =
down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can penetrate al=
most anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter the wavelength the =
more ways we can shield against them.

Think of microwaves. These are also =
a type of radio and telemetry transmitting wave but the waves also have a p=
hysical effect on our environment by causing molecules to speed up, which c=
reates heat. A little lower than this is IR or infrared it too can cause ph=
ysical objects to heat up but usually it just causes molecules to rotate in=
 place. All physical things give off IR light. Its a way the total system c=
onserves energy by spontaneously emitting IR radiation.

Frank R. 


--- On=
 Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrot=
e:


From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
Subject=
: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments] 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Da=
te: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM


Here is some food for thought. I am cur=
rently reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.
=C2=A0
It was me=
 and another girl teammate=C2=A0present in the room. I picked up a 3rd fema=
le voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with me. We were standin=
g right next to another digital video recorder that I leave beside my night=
 vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have asked =
the girl that was with me to check her recording to see if she picked it up=
.
=C2=A0
I have long felt the true EVP does not come from sound waves in th=
e environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow=
 EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.
=C2=A0
This instance with =
the recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder should have pick=
ed that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.
=C2=A0
I am att=
aching the clip of this 3rd voice. The=C2=A0file that is named=C2=A0"01-02-=
17 Clip" is the full clip.=C2=A0You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and=
 then another comes in right after that. I think I know what it says.
=C2=
=A0
Again, I was live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear this unti=
l playback. It isn't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one's fro=
m the last investigation.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
----- Original Message ----- 
From:=
 Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:0=
9 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas

I have a running theory that EVP is =
carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to=
 manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic=
 waves that differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtract the=
m together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if=
 a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a roo=
m creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermedia=
te difference=C2=A0frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz=
 to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic equipment generate=
s ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I always fel=
t that EVP were generated within a few inches of the recorder.

We are able=
 to reproduce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne systems bu=
t also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial =
produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.

Frank R.

--- =

From: Zack Widup=
 <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>

roups .com

Fascinating! I've had this=
 idea that the EVP are often=C2=A0not recorded by the microphone but someho=
w make their way in at the actual=C2=A0point where the storage is made, whe=
ther it be analog (tape) or digital.=C2=A0

So much we don't know ...

Zack=


=C2=A0
On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercromb=
iegh ostresearch. com> wrote:




I monitor my audio live. The funny thing =
is that even so, those last EVP's I captured I did not hear either in the e=
nvironment, or on my recording as it happened. I only heard them upon playb=
ack.
=C2=A0
----- Original Message ----- 
From: Zack Widup 
To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] =
New ideas

I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site =
has ever gotten any EVP in real time.

I=C2=A0took part in=C2=A0an investig=
ation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six vi=
deo cameras set up in the three halls of the building. The video for all=C2=
=A0was being monitored and recorded=C2=A0at a central location. Alas, we di=
d not have microphones at the camera sites conected to the central location=
. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?

Zack

=C2=A0

 2009 at 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:=

Why don't we discu=
ss something on a lighter note? Anyone have any new ideas about either evp =
or ITC? 
Al

erates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I alway=
